[[CITE|724|https://nytimes.com/2017/01/23/us/politics/federal-hiring-freeze.html]] [[CITE|924|http://foxnews.com/politics/2017/01/24/trump-orders-hiring-freeze-for-much-federal-government.html]] The [[LINK|lang_en|Comptroller_General_of_the_United_States|Comptroller General]] of the [[LINK|lang_en|Government_Accountability_Office|Government Accountability Office]] told a [[LINK|lang_en|United_States_House_Committee_on_Oversight_and_Government_Reform|House committee]] that hiring freezes have not proven to be effective in reducing costs. [[CITE|1096|https://washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/02/16/hiring-freeze-could-add-to-governments-risk-gao-chief-warns]] Unlike some past freezes, the current freeze bars agencies from adding contractors to make up for employees leaving. [[CITE|1096|https://washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/wp/2017/02/16/hiring-freeze-could-add-to-governments-risk-gao-chief-warns]]

A week later Trump signed [[LINK|lang_en|Executive_Order_13771|Executive Order 13771]], directing administrative agencies to repeal two existing regulations for every new regulation they issue. [[CITE|340|https://nytimes.com/2016/01/19/us/politics/evangelicals-see-donald-trump-as-man-of-conviction-if-not-faith.html]] [[CITE|340|https://nytimes.com/2016/01/19/us/politics/evangelicals-see-donald-trump-as-man-of-conviction-if-not-faith.html]] [[LINK|lang_en|Harvard_Law_School|Harvard Law]] professor [[LINK|lang_en|Jody_Freeman|Jody Freeman]] said that the order would do no more than slow the regulatory process, because it did not block rules required by statute. [[CITE|340|https://nytimes.com/2016/01/19/us/politics/evangelicals-see-donald-trump-as-man-of-conviction-if-not-faith.html]]
On February 24, 2017, Trump ordered the agencies to create task forces to determine which regulations are deemed burdensome to the U.S. economy.

[[CITE|253|https://reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-regulations-idUSKBN1631NV]] Agency defenders expressed opposition to Trump's criticisms, saying that the bureaucracy exists to protect people against well-organized, well-funded interest groups.
[[CITE|510|http://time.com/4696428/donald-trump-war-state-government]]
Domestic Policy.

Oct 26, 2017 President Trump took a bold step, speaking to reporters at (CNN) and declaring the [[LINK|lang_en|Oxycotin|Oxycontin]] has fueled an *opioid epidemic* a national public health emergency on Thursday, telling an audience in the East Room of the White House that "we can be the generation that ends the *opioid epidemic*."
**This epidemic is a national health emergency.
Foreign policy

Trump has been described as [[LINK|lang_en|Non-interventionism|non-interventionist]] [[CITE|263|http://newyorker.com/news/john-cassidy/donald-trump-is-transforming-the-g-o-p-into-a-populist-nativist-party]] [[CITE|303|https://washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2016/03/21/donald-trump-reveals-foreign-policy-team-in-meeting-with-the-washington-post]] and nationalist. [[CITE|337|http://nationalinterest.org/feature/donald-trump-american-nationalist-14237]] He repeatedly stated that he supports "[[LINK|lang_en|America_First_(policy)|America First]]" foreign policy. [[CITE|340|https://nytimes.com/2016/01/19/us/politics/evangelicals-see-donald-trump-as-man-of-conviction-if-not-faith.html]] He supports increasing United States military defense spending, [[CITE|337|http://nationalinterest.org/feature/donald-trump-american-nationalist-14237]] but favors decreasing United States spending on [[LINK|lang_en|NATO|NATO]] and in the Pacific region. [[CITE|340|https://nytimes.com/2016/01/19/us/politics/evangelicals-see-donald-trump-as-man-of-conviction-if-not-faith.html]] He says America should look inward, stop "nation building", and re-orient its resources toward domestic needs. [[CITE|303|https://washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2016/03/21/donald-trump-reveals-foreign-policy-team-in-meeting-with-the-washington-post]] As a candidate he questioned whether he, as president, would automatically extend [[LINK|lang_en|North_Atlantic_Treaty|security guarantees to NATO members]], [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] and suggested that he might leave NATO unless changes are made to the alliance. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] But as president he has reaffirmed the U.S. commitment to NATO. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]]

In order to confront the [[LINK|lang_en|Islamic_State_of_Iraq_and_Syria|Islamic State of Iraq and Syria]] (ISIS), Trump in 2015 called for seizing the oil in ISIS-occupied areas, using U.S. air power and ground troops. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] In 2016, Trump advocated sending 20,000 to 30,000 U.S. troops to the region, [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] a position he later retracted. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] Regarding the [[LINK|lang_en|Israeli–Palestinian_conflict|Israeli–Palestinian conflict]], Trump has stated the importance of being a neutral party during potential negotiations, while also having stated that he is "a big fan of Israel". [[CITE|326|http://politifact.com/florida/statements/2016/mar/01/conservative-solutions-pac/would-donald-trump-be-neutral-between-israel-and-i]] During the campaign he said he would relocate [[LINK|lang_en|Embassy_of_the_United_States,_Tel_Aviv|the U.S. embassy in Israel]] to [[LINK|lang_en|Jerusalem|Jerusalem]] from its current location, [[LINK|lang_en|Tel_Aviv|Tel Aviv]], although he has not pursued that proposal as president. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]] On May 22, 2017, Trump was the first U.S. president to visit the [[LINK|lang_en|Western_Wall|Western Wall]] in Jerusalem, during his first foreign trip, visiting Israel, Italy, the [[LINK|lang_en|Vatican_City|Vatican]], and [[LINK|lang_en|Belgium|Belgium]]. [[CITE|470|http://cnn.com/2016/10/21/politics/trump-religion-gospel]]
Both as a candidate and as president, Trump repeatedly said he wants a good relationship with Russia.

[[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] Trump has pledged to hold a summit meeting with [[LINK|lang_en|Vladimir_Putin|Vladimir Putin]]. [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] He added that Russia could help the U.S. in [[LINK|lang_en|Military_intervention_against_ISIL|fighting ISIS militants]]. [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] On April 7, 2017, Trump ordered a [[LINK|lang_en|2017_Shayrat_missile_strike|missile strike]] against a Syrian airfield in retaliation for the [[LINK|lang_en|Khan_Shaykhun_chemical_attack|Khan Shaykhun chemical attack]]. [[CITE|278|http://bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-39529605]]
North Korea became a major issue in mid-2017.
During the campaign and the early months of his presidency, Trump had hoped that China would help to rein in North Korea's nuclear ambitions and missile tests.

[[CITE|533|http://npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/17/524316419/pence-tells-north-korea-the-era-of-strategic-patience-is-over]] However, North Korea accelerated its missile testing, leading to an increase in tensions in April 2017.

[[CITE|533|http://npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/17/524316419/pence-tells-north-korea-the-era-of-strategic-patience-is-over]] In July, the country tested two long-range missiles identified by Western observers as [[LINK|lang_en|Intercontinental_ballistic_missile|intercontinental ballistic missiles]], potentially capable of reaching Alaska, Hawaii, and the U.S. mainland. [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]] In August, Trump dramatically escalated his rhetoric against North Korea, warning that further provocation against the U.S. will be met with "fire and fury like the world has never seen." [[CITE|528|http://philly.com/philly/news/politics/presidential/trump-escalates-rhetoric-on-threat-from-north-korea-20170810.html]] North Korean leader [[LINK|lang_en|Kim_Jong-un|Kim Jong-un]] then threatened to direct the country's next missile test toward [[LINK|lang_en|Guam|Guam]]. Trump responded that if North Korea took steps to attack Guam, "[t]hings [would] happen to them like they never thought possible." [[CITE|558|http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/4598495569001]]

items.text: Impeachment efforts and polling

On July 12, 2017, California Representative [[LINK|lang_en|Brad_Sherman|Brad Sherman]] formally introduced an article of impeachment, H. Res. 438, [[CITE|-1|http://sherman.house.gov/sites/sherman.house.gov/files/FINALArticle%20of%20Impeachment.pdf]] accusing the president of obstructing justice regarding the [[LINK|lang_en|2017_Special_Counsel_investigation|investigation of Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election]]. [[CITE|99|http://thehill.com/homenews/house/341677-house-dem-files-article-of-impeachment-against-trump]]

[[LINK|lang_en|Opinion_polling_on_the_Donald_Trump_administration|Presidential approval ratings for Trump]] have revealed him to be the least popular US president in the history of modern opinion polling as of the first ten months of the term. [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]]
2020 presidential campaign
Trump signaled his intention to run for a second term by filing with the FEC within hours of assuming the presidency.

[[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] This transformed his 2016 election committee into a 2020 reelection one. [[CITE|666|https://donaldjtrump.com/press-releases/trump-campaign-announces-evangelical-executive-advisory-board]] Trump marked the official start of the campaign with a campaign rally in [[LINK|lang_en|Melbourne,_Florida|Melbourne, Florida]], on February 18, 2017, less than a month after taking office. [[CITE|770|http://jewishvoiceny.com/index.php?Iteref=&catid=121%3Aspecial-features&id=10058%3Aalgemeiner-journal-jewish-100-gala-honors-donald-trump-joan-rivers-and-yuli-edelsterin&lang=en&option=com_content&view=article]] By February 1, 2017, the campaign had already raised over $7 million. [[CITE|770|http://jewishvoiceny.com/index.php?Iteref=&catid=121%3Aspecial-features&id=10058%3Aalgemeiner-journal-jewish-100-gala-honors-donald-trump-joan-rivers-and-yuli-edelsterin&lang=en&option=com_content&view=article]]
Awards, honors, and distinctions
Honorary degrees

sentences.text: [[LINK|lang_en|Jewish_National_Fund_Tree_of_Life_Award|Tree of Life Award]] by the [[LINK|lang_en|Jewish_National_Fund|Jewish National Fund]], for contributions to [[LINK|lang_en|Israel–United_States_relations|Israel–United States relations]].
